speakers.name: Theo Browne
speakers.title: Ping.gg
speakers.bio: â€‹Theo Browne is the founder & CEO of http://ping.gg and a popular YouTuber. He streams (& tweets @t3dotgg) about topics related to web development. Formerly he was a backend engineer at Twitch before founding his own startup.

speakers.name: Christoph Nakazawa
speakers.title: Engineering Manager
speakers.talkTitle: Game Development from Scratch with React
speakers.talkAbstract: Do easy solutions come at the expense of high performance? In this talk, we'll explore this question as I build a video game from the ground up with JavaScript & React. Along this journey, you'll gain valuable insights into rapid prototyping, test infrastructure, and a range of CSS tricks that can be applied to both game development and your day-to-day work. And perhaps it may even rekindle a love for creating something meaningful & fulfilling, as it did for me!
speakers.bio: Christoph is an experienced engineering manager, frontend lead and aspiring game developer. He has played a key role in the development of tools such as Jest, React Native, Metro, and Yarn while working at companies like Facebook and Stripe. Currently Christoph is exploring game development and optimizing his workflows and is excited to share more in 2023.
speakers.headerBio: Former Meta engineer who contributed to the development of Jest, React Native, Metro, and Yarn

speakers.name: Wes Bos
speakers.title: Engineer & Entrepreneur
speakers.bio: Wes is a prolific educator, conference speaker, workshop instructor, and co-host of the popular Syntax.fm podcast. He loves creating educational courses on web development. He lives and works in Hamilton, Canada.
speakers.headerBio: Wes is a prolific educator, conference speaker, workshop instructor, and co-host of the popular Syntax.fm podcast. He loves creating educational courses on web development.

speakers.name: Una Kravets
speakers.title: Staff Developer Relations Engineer
speakers.bio: Una Kravets leads the UI & DevTools Developer Relations Team at Google Chrome. Previously, she was the Director of Product Design at Bustle Digital Group and worked on building maintainable design systems as a UI engineer at DigitalOcean and IBM. Una is the co-host of two web dev podcasts: Toolsday, the CSS Podcast, and the web video series Designing in the Browser. She has built open-source libraries such as CSSgram, spoken at over 70 developer events, and is an avid calligrapher/doodler.
speakers.headerBio: Making the web more stylish âœ¨ðŸŽ¨ UI & DevTools DevRel @ Google Chrome

speakers.name: Tanner Linsley
speakers.title: Engineer & Owner
speakers.talkTitle: The Architectural Philosophy of the Tanstack
speakers.talkAbstract: When evaluating a software tool, thereâ€™s a lot to consider. Not only should it solve your technical problems, but it should align with your architectural philosophy. Why are some patterns & features implemented over others? How do the contributions from the community affect the decisions of the maintainers? What is the opportunity cost of selecting a similar competing library? In this talk, weâ€™ll explore the architectural philosophy of the Tanstack. Focusing specifically on Tanstack Router & related libraries, weâ€™ll explore how these tools can help your company to ship faster, and scale for the long-term, safely.
speakers.bio: Tanner Linsley has been building software for 10+ years, mostly in the front-end space. He cofounded Nozzle, an SEO analytics SaaS platform, and also created TanStack, his open source umbrella company for web developer tools. He enjoys building open source software, traveling and spoiling his family.
speakers.headerBio: Software engineer, entrepreneur, and proprietor of the Tanstack

speakers.name: David Khourshid
speakers.title: Founder
speakers.bio: David is a software engineer who loves playing piano and is passionate about animations, state machines, cutting-edge user interfaces, and open-source. Previously at Microsoft, he is now the founder of Stately, a startup focused on making even the most complex application logic visual and accessible to developers and non-developers alike.

speakers.name: Colin Sidoti
speakers.title: CEO & Co-founder
speakers.bio: Colin is co-founder of Clerk, where he helps build authentication and user management tools for React. He has 15 years of frontend experience and is obsessed with making frontend developers more autonomous.

speakers.name: Shawn Swyx Wang
speakers.title: Head of Developer Experience
speakers.bio: swyx has helped Developer Tools cross the chasm at AWS, Two Sigma, and three devtool unicorns - Netlify, Temporal, and most recently at Airbyte. He has started and run communities for hundreds of thousands of developers, like Svelte Society, /r/reactjs, and the React TypeScript Cheatsheet. His blog (https://swyx.io/ideas) covers Tech, Careers, and Indie Hacking, and his nontechnical writing was published in the Coding Career Handbook for Junior to Senior developers.
speakers.headerBio: Software engineer, blogger, podcast host, & international speaker

speakers.name: Sunil Pai
speakers.title: Chief
speakers.bio: Sunil builds developer tools for ambitious applications at Cool Computer Club. He's previously been on the React team, worked at companies like Meta, Cloudflare, JP Morgan, Flipkart, and is known for open source libraries like glamor. He can be found playing a blue Les Paul or swimming the neighbourhood pond in London.
speakers.headerBio: Former React Core engineer; Meta & Cloudflare Alum
